presentation_title: The 1st International Congress on Phonetics and Poetics
presentation_text: The 1st International Congress on Phonetics and Poetics -created by the homonymous group that connects the universities of Granada, Santiago de Chile and Concepción, in collaboration with the European project Voices of Spanish Poets- is the first scientific meeting -in recent times- dedicated to the dissemination of the phonetic-acoustic study of poetry and from an interdisciplinary perspective. Its modality will be completely virtual and free of charge, in order to favor the participation of all researchers in this area of study and who are deployed around the world.

group.title: Phonetics and Poetics Research Group
group.content_1: A group united by the idea that phonetic studies and poetic studies are closely related.
content_2: Domingo Román Montes de Oca (University of Santiago, Chile)
content_3: To approach the instrumental phonetic study of Spanish language poetry
To promote the instrumental phonetic study of poetry as a legitimate (and neglected) research area
To build an international network of researchers working on the topic with similar and different scientific approaches
To propose various instances to disseminate this research perspective of the poetic object

announcement.title: 1st Edition of the International Congress on Phonetics and Poetics FyP
announcement.subtitle: The Acoustic Dimension of Poetry: Instrumental and Interdisciplinary Perspectives
announcement.paragraph_1: Originally, from the early 20th century, phonetics was closely related to poetic studies and even to the instrumental analysis of speech (Mustazza, 2019), and the relationship between linguistics and poetry has been shown to be strongly connected, as Jakobson (1966) demonstrates. However, despite the growing number of vocal archives and strategies for preserving poetic speech internationally (see Colonna, 2021, Mistrorigo 2019), this branch of research has been little explored over time.
announcement.paragraph_2: In recent years, this gap has been reduced in various international areas, through theoretical approaches that have opened the debate on the subject (Bernstein, 1999), encompassing various disciplinary branches, which is allowing the beginning of awareness, sensitization, and an increase in the instrumental and interdisciplinary study of this specific and very complex form of speech and its relationship with the written text (e.g., Byers 1979; MacArthur et al. 2018; Colonna, 2022; Barbosa, 2023). This congress aims to contribute to this specific branch of research.
announcement.paragraph_3: For this reason, the recently created international research group Phonetics and Poetics, in collaboration with the Voices of Spanish Poets project, cordially invites all those interested in this area of research to participate in the first edition of the International Congress on Phonetics and Poetics, to be held on November 15, 2024, online.
announcement.paragraph_4: We invite all scholars working on the acoustic dimension of poetry from different approaches to submit a proposal in one of the following thematic areas proposed for the congress:
list: Phonetics and Poetry: dedicated to the phonetic study of recordings of read or oral poetry
Phonetics and Applied Poetics (Didactics): dedicated to the applications of teaching poetry through phonetics at different levels of instruction

Phonetics, Cognition, and Poetics: dedicated to the study of the results of the acoustic and perceptive dimension of poetic reading through psycholinguistic, cognitive, and psychophysiological correlates methodologies
Metrics: dedicated to the prosodic dimension of the poetic text in relation to its execution and interpretation aloud
